text: The first day on the zombie apocalypse is really important.
$(br2)Your objective is to find plants on the surface and punch them (they will glow). When they die, they drop different types of Plant Food.
The Plant Foods are important to make different plants, but most importantly you will find Sunflower Seeds around. Punch them to get their Seed Packet.
After finding x2 Sunflower Seed Seed Packet, craft a Sunflower.
Sunflowers produce Sun, which is used to craft most plants.
$(br)After crafting your Sunflowers, find a nice place to call home and plant them on your lawn.
When you place your Sunflower you will notice that it will give you 2 Suns already, this is the perfect amount to make a Peashooter, make one.
$(br2)You may have already noticed the main threat of this mod by now: the Zombies.
$(br2)While you can defeat them by yourself, they have lots of health and will easily overwhelm you, so the best solution is to craft Plants.
Your first Peashooter will be crucial for that, but be sure to help it by attacking tough zombies and planting more Plants.
Bellflowers are weak but cheap and effective, make one or two if you can.
They deal the same damage as the Peashooter, but to all zombies in an area while ignoring armor, with limited range being the drawback.
Potato Mines will ensure the safety of your plants if you have a hole in your defenses,
as it will be able to instantly kill any zombie that can spawn at this moment in the game.
Wall-nuts are one of the most import plants to have. They funnel the zombies to their location, allowing your plants to attack without risking themselves.
Cabbage-pults are really useful long range plants that while weaker than a peashooter can ignore shields and shoot through weird terrain.
$(br2)The Zombies will spawn from Graves. At first the Graves will vanish the moment they spawn a wave of zombies,
but later on they will spawn more waves before vanishing.
Difficulty influences this. Strong Zombies will not spawn on the first days on Normal and below.
$(br2)While you wait for night time, we recommend crafting these plants to help you.
